			mixed
			$_actualValue
			 =  null			(line 53)
		
	


	

The Actual value entered using the DSL. This is used  to run the Matcher and ascertain a passing or failing  matching operation.

	
    
				
  • access: protected
    • 
			

	
	
		
		







	

		
		
			PHPSpec_Expectation
			$_expectation
			 =  null			(line 36)
		
	


	

An object representation of a expectation representing  "should" or "should not" states

	
    
				
  • access: protected
    • 
			

	
	
		
		







	

		
		
			mixed
			$_expectedValue
			 =  null			(line 44)
		
	


	

The Expected value entered using the DSL. This is used  to instantiate the relevant Matcher object.

	
    
				
  • access: protected
    • 
			

	
	
		
		







	

		
		
			mixed
			$_matcher
			 =  null			(line 70)
		
	


	

The Matcher object used to ascertain whether an expected  and actual match for the given Matcher's criteria (e.g  equals, instanceof, greater then, etc.)


PHPSpec_Matcher_Interface

	
    
				
  • access: protected
    •

			 =  null			(line 61)
		
	


	

The overall result of the Matcher operation as  a boolean

		static getSpec (line 81)
	
 
	
	

Public static factory method to create a new Specification (DSL)  object based on the given object or scalar value.


Accepts a variable number of parameters in the case of object  values for the classname and any constructor arguments.

	
    
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		static PHPSpec_Specification
		
			getSpec
		
				()
			

	
		
			
	




	
	

		
		getActualValue (line 258)
	
 
	
	

Get an Actual value with which to call a Matcher operation  and ascertain whether Expected and Actual values match.

		getExpectation (line 213)
	
 
	
	

Return the Expectation object ruling how Matcher results are  interpreted (whether a matcher boolean result counts as a pass  or a fail).

	
    
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		PHPSpec_Expectation
		
			getExpectation

    •

			getExpectedValue
		
				()
			

	
		
			
	




	
	

		
		getMatcherFailureMessage (line 306)
	
 
	
	

Get the textual description of a failed Matcher where  we expected the result to be TRUE (i.e. matched) based  on a positive "should" Expectation.


That is to say, "$foo should be 1" was expected to result in  in a positive match but instead failed.

	
    
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		string
		
			getMatcherFailureMessage
		
				()
			

	
		
			
	




	
	

		
		getMatcherNegativeFailureMessage (line 321)
	
 
	
	

Get the textual description of a failed Matcher where  we expected the result to be FALSE (i.e. unmatched) based  on a negative "should not" Expectation.


That is to say, "$foo should not be 1" was expected to result in  in a failed match but instead passed.

	
    
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		string
		
			getMatcherNegativeFailureMessage
		
				()

		setRunner (line 333)
	
 
	
	

Set the overall class which manages the running of specs. The usual  default here is assumed to be PHPSpec_Runner_Base.

	
    
				
  • todo: Do we not yet have a Runner interface to reference?
    • 
				
  • access: public

		_createMatcher (line 345)
	
 
	
	

A factory method to create a new Matcher object based on calls  to the DSL grammer.

	
    
				
  • access: protected
    • 
			

	
	

		null
		
			_createMatcher
		
					(DSL $method)
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				DSL
				$method: method call which was found to be a Matcher reference

		_performMatching (line 358)
	
 
	
	

Perform a Matcher operation and set the returned boolean result for  further analysis, e.g. comparison to the boolean Expectation.

	
    
				
  • access: protected
    •

				array
				$args

		__call (line 108)
	
 
	
	

Magic __call method for detecting DSL grammer elements and


diverting them to the relevant real methods we are utilising  or returning an instance of self if simply a "link" grammer  term which exists for the purpose of enabling a natural  English grammer.

	
    
				
  • return: An instance of self or TRUE if a Matcher was run
    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		mixed
		
			__call
		
					(string $method, array $args)
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				string
				$method			
    • 
					
  • 
				array
				$args			
    •

				PHPSpec_Specification_Object::__call()
							
    • 
					
  • 
				PHPSpec_Specification_Scalar::__call()
							
    • 
				

	




	
	

		
		__get (line 186)
	
 
	
	

Very similar to __call(), simply diverts property requests to relevant  methods (which allows the dropping of method braces) or returns an  instance of self. So "$spec->be" equates to "$spec->be()".

	
    
				
  • return: An instance of self
    • 
				
  • access: public
    • 
			

	
	

		PHPSpec_Specification
		
			__get
		
					(string $name)
			

	
			
    
					
  • 
				string
				$name: The method name to call (without braces)			
    • 
				

		
			
			

		
Redefined in descendants as:

		
    
					
  • 
				PHPSpec_Specification_Object::__get()
							
    • 
					
  • 
				PHPSpec_Specification_Scalar::__get()
							
    •
